author: Special Correspondent
text:
More than 350 students from 60 polytechnic colleges across the country presented technical papers on eight different topics at the national technical symposium and displayed 200 projects in the project exhibition held at the Thiagarajar Polytechnic College in the city recently.

The events were organised by the Thiagarajar Polytechnic College in association with the students chapters of Institution of Engineers (India) and The Indian Society for Technical Education.

Students of more than 20 schools from different parts of Salem district, too, participated in the exhibition and displayed their project models. S.S. Yuvaraj, Convenor, MSME, CII, Salem, was the chief guest at the valediction. He urged the students to “adapt” to any situation and also to “update” their knowledge in the technical field.

C. Thyagu Valliappa, Vice-Chairman, Sona Group of Institutions, presided.

V. Karthikeyan, Principal, Thiagarajar Polytechnic College, stated that different streams of thoughts and more ideas can be evolved through these types of symposia.

Cash prize distributed

Prize money of Rs. 1 lakh was distributed for the best technical papers and best project models.
title: Students told to update knowledge
